body_html:
@civilmanxx : Could you elaborate on what you mean by "it uses gpu:2 instead"? The device names in TensorFlow will correspond to the GPUs accessible to it, while the CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES environment variable is what the CUDA framework uses to restrict visibility. So, if CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES="1", then TensorFlow programs should not be able to see multiple GPUs.

Perhaps you can provide a reproducible example of the program you're using and the output of things like nvidia-smi and others like @sherrym mentioned above, to help explain what the problem is?

The device names in TensorFlow will correspond to the GPUs accessible to it, while the `CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES` environment variable is what the CUDA framework uses to restrict visibility.
